about_the_game:
CONCEPT



Ticket to Silverton is a co-operative multiplayer game for up to 4 players that sends you on an exciting train journey.
The aim is to reach the town of Silverton within five days.
But the journey holds plenty of challenges - and a deadly threat.

Players steer a locomotive through various areas that appear calm and unspectacular at first glance.
However, new problems occur on the train in each level - from minor breakdowns to critical damage.
Together you have to repair them to keep the locomotive moving.

In addition to the train problems, an approaching toxic storm adds to the pressure. As soon as it approaches, players must don gas masks in order to survive.
But these masks have a limited shelf life.
At the same time, you have to find solutions in the short time available to protect the train from the effects of the storm!

5 days, 5 areas. No mistakes!

Each level represents a day of the journey and brings with it new areas and challenges.

If you don't manage to protect the train or fix the problems in time, the train becomes unusable. The crew (i.e. the players) will succumb to the storm as the gas mask won't last forever. This means you have to start the day all over again.

Can your group make it through all five days, solve the problems and outwit the toxic storm to reach Silverton safely?

ART-STYLE



The art style of Ticket to Silverton is stylised, with a mixture of fantasy and dream world look. The world is colourful and surreal, with smooth transitions and imaginative elements. The areas look like something out of a dream, with unusual colours and details that give the environment a special atmosphere.

The focus was on making the graphics as good as possible to make the game not only visually appealing, but also fun and varied. The textures are high quality, the lighting effects are harmonious and the animations are fluid, making the experience feel lively and modern.

Thanks to the imaginative style, the different areas in the game can be designed in a variety of ways, so that each new level offers a new, interesting atmosphere. This art style supports the gameplay and ensures that the game remains not only challenging but also visually exciting.

FEATURES & CONTENT



➤ Co-operative multiplayer in which up to 4 players work together to control the train and solve problems.

➤ Five days, each day is a new level with unique challenges.

➤ Repair and manage the train to continue the journey.

➤ The approaching storm influences the gameplay and requires quick decisions.

➤ A stylised look that combines imaginative and dreamlike elements.

short_description: Ticket to Silverton is a multiplayer game for up to 4 players. You travel with a locomotive through different areas, solving problems on the train along the way and preparing for a big storm. Teamwork is important to survive the journey!
